item.title: Shared-hosting accounts victims of lame directory permissions
item.description: From a few months some clients started to complain about their shared-hosting accounts being amazingly owned even if their PHP applications (WordPress mostly) were totally up to date. The malware got into most of the PHP files including a PHP snippet that would eval and decode a base64-encoded string containing a script declaration loading Javascript from outside. This Javascript usually initiates download of .exe’s and stuff. A friend’s account got hacked a few days back by this very same technique.
